meanings.definition: A long, narrow strip of material used for binding or tying.
meanings.sent1: She used a ribband to tie her hair back.
meanings.sent2: The package was secured with a ribband.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the ribband, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a strong ribband, holding them together.
meanings.sent5: The bright red ribband stood out against the dark fabric.

meanings.definition: A band of wood or metal used to strengthen a structure.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter added a ribband to support the frame.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was reinforced with a sturdy ribband.
meanings.sent3: The ribband creaked under the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent4: The ribband of steel held the building upright in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The ribband of wood ran along the length of the ship, keeping it strong.

meanings.definition: A decorative strip or band used in clothing or textiles.
meanings.sent1: The dress was adorned with a beautiful ribband.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a delicate ribband onto the hem of the skirt.
meanings.sent3: The ribband added a touch of elegance to the plain shirt.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were drawn to the shimmering ribband on the scarf.
meanings.sent5: The ribband of gold thread sparkled in the sunlight.
